data.name: Yanmega

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch Yanmega with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The beat of its wings is so powerful that it accidentally dislodges full-grown trees when it takes off in flight.

abilities.name: Major Tsunami
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Feraligatr is your Active Pokémon and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. Either way, if you have any Benched Pokémon, switch Feraligatr with 1 of them. This power can't be used if Feraligatr is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rending Jaws
attacks.text: If here are no damage counters on the Defending Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 70.

data.name: Hakamo-o

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they're regrown.

data.name: Duskull

attacks.name: Dark Guidance
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.

data.flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

data.name: Espeon

abilities.name: Solar Revelation
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Psy Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

data.flavorText: Its fur is so sensitive, it can sense minute shifts in the air and predict the weather.

data.name: Dragonite

ancientTrait.name: Δ Plus
ancientTrait.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Wrapped in Wind
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

data.name: Girafarig

attacks.name: Crane Neck
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Its tail also has a small brain. It bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on it from behind.

data.name: Unown [D]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Darkness]
abilities.text: Whenever a Darkness Pokémon damages 1 of your Pokémon, reduce that damage by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). This power stops working if you have more than 1 Unown [D] in play. (This power works even if Unown [D] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

attacks.name: Mud Splash
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Aggron

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aura of the Land
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Aqua Shower
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Brine
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

data.name: Tympole

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Mismagius

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.

attacks.name: Sniff Out
attacks.text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Corrosive Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Natu

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Natu with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.

data.name: Murkrow

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It hides any shiny object it finds in a secret location. Murkrow and Meowth loot one another's stashes.

attacks.name: Dragon Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Skorupi

attacks.name: Hone Claws
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Pierce attack's base damage is 90.

data.flavorText: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

data.name: Gothitelle

attacks.name: Mental Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.

data.name: Sobble
data.flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Venipede
data.flavorText: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

data.name: Wimpod

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.flavorText: It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.

data.name: Inteleon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Snipe
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

attacks.name: Max Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Inkay

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If Carvanha is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Carvanha is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

abilities.name: Ancient Tentacles
abilities.text: Damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by your Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, Kabutops, or Kabutops ex isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Whimsicott

attacks.name: Windy Mischief
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

data.name: Skiploom

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.

data.name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Poison Up
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, put 3 more damage counters on that Pokémon between turns. This effect can be applied more than once.

data.flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

data.name: Remoraid

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.flavorText: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix

abilities.name: Secret Alleyway
abilities.text: If you have any Fairy Pokémon in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: In hot weather, this Pokémon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.

data.name: Vikavolt

abilities.name: Strong Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Energy card and a Lightning Energy card and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electro Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

data.name: Parasect

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

attacks.name: Pebble Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Damage from this attack is reduced by 10 for each damage counter on Primeape.

attacks.name: Sudden Charge
attacks.text: Primeape does 10 damage to itself. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Cofagrigus

abilities.name: Six Feet Under
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack) you may Knock Out this Pokémon. If you do, put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Slap of Misfortune
attacks.text: Whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her next turn, treat it as tails.

data.flavorText: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

data.name: Dark Raticate

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: A Raticate's front teeth are incredibly powerful; it can destroy a two-story house with them in 5 minutes.

data.name: Beartic

attacks.name: Frozen Slice
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Monferno

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Monferno.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It skillfully control the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to Eevee, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee that is the same type as the Energy card you attached to Eevee. Put that card onto Eevee. (This counts as evolving Eevee.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used when you attach an Energy card to Eevee as part of an attack's effect.

data.name: Pumpkaboo

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

abilities.name: Pure Body
abilities.text: To attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, you must discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (Attach the Water Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Suicune.)

attacks.name: Hypno Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Golisopod

abilities.name: Emergency Exit
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has 2 or fewer Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: The shell covering its body is as hard as diamond. This Pokémon will do anything it takes to win.

attacks.name: The Hula-la
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, both the Defending Pokémon and Spinda are now Confused.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Spinda.

data.name: Nidoking

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: King's Drum
attacks.text: If Nidoqueen is on your Bench, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is recognized by its rock-hard hide and its extended horn. Be careful with the horn, as it contains venom.

data.name: Unown [F]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Find]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [F], Unown [I], Unown [N], and Unown [D] on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Trainer card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

data.name: Makuhita

attacks.name: Slap Down
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.

data.name: Manectric

abilities.name: High Speed
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.

data.flavorText: It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so it can move quickly. It eases its soreness with electricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks during your opponent's next turn, any damage it does is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Spike Ball Tackle
attacks.text: Togepi does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its shell is said to contain happiness itself, which it will share with those who are kind to it.

data.name: Sunflora

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Sunflora is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Charizard-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Storm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Out-GX
attacks.text: Discard the top 10 cards of your opponent's deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Zygarde-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Land's Pulse
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Grip and Squeeze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Power Guillotine
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 100.

data.flavorText: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can't tear, it tosses far.

data.name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blaze Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Rapidash and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.text: Drowzee can't be Asleep.

attacks.name: Soothing Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

data.name: Aipom

attacks.name: Imitate
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent.

data.flavorText: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon so that its remaining HP are 10.

data.name: Aipom

attacks.name: Last Resort
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It uses its tail to pluck fruits that are out of reach. Its tail is more adept than its real hands.

data.name: Crobat

abilities.name: Night Sight
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Ultra-Toxic Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on this Pokémon between turns.

data.flavorText: Having four wings allows it to fly more quickly and quietly so it can sneak up on prey without its noticing.

data.name: Drapion

attacks.name: Dangerous Stinger
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

abilities.name: Shining Horn
abilities.text: As long as Skarmory is the only Pokémon you have in play, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Skarmory by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Gulpin

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: There is nothing its stomach can't digest. While it is digesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.

attacks.name: Aqua Trance
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Whirlipede

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

data.name: Darmanitan

attacks.name: Synchrodraw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: DarMAXitan
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue. Then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.

data.name: Porygon2

abilities.name: Download
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Supporter card from your hand and use the effect of that card as the effect of this power. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is affected by a Special Condition.

data.flavorText: With planetary development software installed, it became capable of working in space.

data.name: Roggenrola

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 40 or less.

data.flavorText: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

attacks.name: Mend
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Steelix GL. If you do, remove 1 damage counter from Steelix GL.

attacks.name: Squeeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

data.name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

data.name: Toxicroak

abilities.name: Poison Enzyme
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

data.name: Kommo-o

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Raging Uppercut
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has 8 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.

data.name: Burmy Trash Cloak

abilities.name: Cloak Evolution
abilities.text: Burmy Trash Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

data.flavorText: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from Slakoth. Slakoth can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Quagsire but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Misty's Starmie but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Centiskorch

attacks.name: Hundred Foot Flames
attacks.text: For each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

abilities.name: Fire Immunity
abilities.text: You can't attach Fire Energy cards from your hand to Moltres.

attacks.name: Collect Fire
attacks.text: If there are any Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Moltres.

attacks.name: Burning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Moltres.

data.name: Kyurem

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glaciate
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It generates powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

data.name: Floette

abilities.name: Flower Veil
abilities.text: Each of your Grass Pokémon in play gets +20 HP.

data.flavorText: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Pulse Search
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: It loves the blood of humans and Pokémon. It flies around at night in search of neck veins.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flaaffy does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Machamp

abilities.name: Fighting Fury
abilities.text: Each of your Fighting Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Machamp Crush
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.

data.name: Shuckle

abilities.name: Hard Shell
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 40 or less damage to Shuckle (after applying Weakness and Resistance), reduce that damage to 10. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Shuckle is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Saliva
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

data.flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

data.name: Garbodor

abilities.name: Garbotoxin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Garbotoxin).

data.flavorText: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.

data.name: Hitmonchan

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

data.name: Onix

abilities.name: Energy Healer
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to Onix, remove a damage counter from Onix.

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: Onix can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

data.name: Gothorita

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.

data.name: Ralts

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

data.name: Bibarel

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.

data.name: Duosion
data.flavorText: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Retaliate

abilities.name: Assistance

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Wigglytuff by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

data.name: Giratina-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Renegade Pulse

attacks.name: Chaos Wheel

data.name: Slowking

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Being bitten by Shellder gave it intelligence comparable to that of award-winning scientists.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon. If 1 of your Pokémon used Barrier during your last turn, this attack can't be used.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon whose genetic code was repeatedly recombined for research. It turned vicious as a result.

abilities.name: Overeager
abilities.text: If Sableye is your Active Pokémon at the beginning of the game, you go first. (If each player's Active Pokémon has the Overeager Poké-Body, this power does nothing.)

attacks.name: Impersonate
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card and discard it. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Overconfident
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Sableye, this attack's base damage is 40.

data.name: Malamar

abilities.name: Psychic Recharge

data.flavorText: It lures prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

data.name: Ducklett

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

data.name: Jirachi-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Stellar Guidance
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hypnostrike
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Flip Over
attacks.text: Beldum does 10 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

data.name: Erika's Hospitality
rules: You can play this card only if you have 4 or fewer other cards in your hand.
Draw a card for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.

data.name: Drizzile

abilities.name: Shady Dealings
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

data.name: Magnemite

abilities.name: Sparkling Induction
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, its Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Magnemite on your Bench.

data.flavorText: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.

data.flavorText: It follows Onixes in their tunnels, looking for scraps of food they have left behind.

data.name: Altaria

ancientTrait.text: You may play this card from your hand to evolve a Pokémon during your first turn or the turn you play that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Clear Humming

data.flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

data.name: Drowzee

data.flavorText: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.

abilities.name: Chaos Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent has 3 or fewer Prizes, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hide in Shadows
attacks.text: Switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 8 cards.

data.flavorText: Individually, they're incredibly weak. It's by gathering up into schools that they're able to confront opponents.

data.name: Machoke
data.flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It spits out poisonpowder to immobilize the enemy, and then finishes the enemy with a spray of acid.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nidoqueen is on your Bench, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from your Active Pokémon and attach it to your Active Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Skrelp
data.flavorText: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.

data.name: Drifblim

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Drifblim by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

data.name: Mewtwo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: X Ball
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psydrive
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tropius during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Blessed Fruit
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Grass Pokémon.

abilities.name: Extra Protection
abilities.text: As long as you have Illumise in play, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Volbeat by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Zygarde-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Land's Pulse
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Cell Storm
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Oranguru

attacks.name: Fixer of the Forest
attacks.text: Put 3 Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it's best suited to veteran Trainers.

data.name: Floette

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

data.name: Machamp

abilities.name: Fighting Fury
abilities.text: Each of your Fighting Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Machamp Crush
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.

data.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Dark Invitation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent reveal their hand. Put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench, and put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

data.name: Ho-Oh-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Phoenix Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Phoenix Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Eternal Light-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 in any combination of Fire Pokémon-GX or Fire Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Drive Off
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Swellow is your Active Pokémon, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent picks the Benched Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Swellow is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Tail Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: X-ray photos were taken to check its body structure. Nothing appeared, however.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Pokémon Center Lady
rules: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Spoink

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.

data.name: Geodude

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

attacks.name: Vital Pinchers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Goomy

abilities.name: Water Down
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, you may search your deck for Goomy and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.

data.name: Pyukumuku

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: One-Two Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly three years. That is the only time the mother is heard to cry wildly.

data.name: Zebstrika

abilities.name: Zap Zone
abilities.text: Damage from the attacks of your Lightning Pokémon isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crashing Bolt
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has Fighting Resistance, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Mewtwo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Regeneration
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Quagsire

abilities.name: Aqua Healing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Quagsire is your Active Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, you may remove 3 damage counters from Quagsire.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It has a sluggish nature. It lies at the river's bottom, waiting for prey to stray into its mouth.

data.name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

data.flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

data.name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Octillery

attacks.name: Water Vein
attacks.text: Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Flip a coin for each Energy card you find there. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. Shuffle the revealed cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Octazooka
attacks.text: Any time the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. (If the Defending Pokémon is no longer your opponent's Active Pokémon, this effect ends.)

data.flavorText: It loves to lurk inside holes in rocks. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth.

data.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd don't count.

data.flavorText: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming over trying to stand.

data.name: Toxapex

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon and heal all damage from it.

attacks.name: Poisonous Whip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.

data.name: Weavile

abilities.name: Tear Away
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may put a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon into your hand.

data.flavorText: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

data.name: Shelgon

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.

data.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.

data.name: Aron

attacks.name: Mountain Eater
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. Then, remove 2 damage counters from Aron.

data.flavorText: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.

data.name: Roggenrola

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Poison Barb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.

data.name: Gothitelle

attacks.name: Tractorbeam
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

data.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.

data.name: Swanna

attacks.name: Tailwind
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Tentacool

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It drifts through the sea searching for prey. Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes, but after a while, they grow back.

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The capture of the first Dratini inspired the search for other legendary Pokémon.

data.name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: If you think that you had a good dream but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.

data.name: Onix

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.

data.name: Electrike

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

data.name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Storm Up
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Crash Impact
attacks.text: Rhydon does 10 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.flavorText: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.

data.name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Psychic Strategy
attacks.text: Each player counts the number of cards in his or her opponent's hand. Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a number of cards up to the number of cards his or her opponent had. (You draw your cards first.)

attacks.name: Super Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Discard as many Energy cards as you like attached to your Pokémon. For each Energy card you discarded, flip a coin. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

data.name: Sliggoo

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.

data.name: Purrloin

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

data.name: Meowstic

abilities.name: Mysterious Ears
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psyblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

data.name: Jessie & James
rules: Each player discards 2 cards from their hand. Your opponent discards first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Swalot

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: If, before doing damage, your opponent's Active Pokémon has less remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special enzymes can dissolve anything.
